manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Previous page Grows with the Family Make your Qool a single, double, or triple with configurations for up to three kids! 4 Configurations Out-of-Box! Two adjustable seat level options and the option to face the world or parent! Premium Expandable Canopy Features like peek-a-boo window, UPF 50 sun protection & zippered expansion for the shade they need. Telescopic Leatherette Parent Handle Height adjustable with extra-grip leatherette for a comfortable and secure push. Made with Durable Zinc Diecast Extra-large back 12" back tiresFront-wheel suspensionMetal frame with 135 lb. weight capacity Next page 1 All the Options 2 Customizable 3 Canopy 4 Parent Handle 5 Smooth and Sturdy Ride

Grow From Single to Double to Triple With One Stroller 4 Configurations Out of Box The seat can be in the upper or lower position. It can also either face out or face the parent. The seats are reclinable and the fabric is washable. Rubber Wheels Real rubber 12" rear wheels and 8" front wheel with quick release feature, and a one-step linked parking brake. Premium Extendable Canopy UPF 50 sun protection with extendable zippered expansion, water repellent stretchy-spandex blend, and a ventilated mesh peek-a-boo window. Additional Included Features This luxury stroller also includes a large storage basket, swing-open and removable bumper bar, and a leatherette, height adjustable parent handlebar.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great little seat!
reviews.reviewText: I think the bench seat was one of the deciding factors for us to get the Joovy Qool stroller. There is going to be less than 2 year age gap between my girls and other “grow-with-your-family” strollers mostly offer the ride on boards which I don’t feel would be enough for my older one to use when we for example go to a zoo or make a quick trip to the library. The bench seat gives her a place to safely sit l, get buckled, and take a break should she need it.That being said, the triple seat set up with the bench is not perfect with limited space available but we plan to use it with two children only and that gives us plenty of flexibility with the offered configurations.It’s also super easy to set up and take off which I really appreciate with not just the bench seat but also all the other parts on the stroller as this was another reason why we switched from another popular brand - the need of separate adapters for each seat / configuration.Overall I am excited to use the bench seat and so is our toddler who climbed right in when we were testing it upon receiving it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for my toddler
reviews.reviewText: My toddler has been fighting sitting in the bucket seat of the stroller. We were recently gifted this attachment since having our 2nd child and she LOVES this seat. She can see all around. Let’s us know when she’s ready to sit down. Really easy to transition on the stroller

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good for trio!
reviews.reviewText: Love this chair. Got it for my 4 year old who didn't want to walk when the twins got to sit in the stroller. It's been very useful in daily life, the twins are 2 now, so they will take turns and take a ride in this seat when big sister wants to recline under the canopy. Definitely has brought a little more peace on our family outings.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Kids love this

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great option for an easier-to-push double stroller
reviews.reviewText: I have a 45lbs three year old and a three month old. We use this with a car seat to turn our Qool into a double — much, much easier to push than two seats or seat and car seat, and fairly easy to navigate around narrow NYC store aisles and crowded sidewalks. Definitely recommend for anyone looking for a more compact/easier to push double option.Only two things to flag. First, if you’re on the taller side, you may kick the footrest when walking. (I don’t have this problem at 5’1 but my 6’2 husband does.) Second, kids have full access to the rear wheels while seated on the bench, so can kick feet into the wheels or pinch fingers. My son got his foot caught on one of our first outings and it was pretty scary for everyone. He learned his lesson and it only happened once, but wish I’d noticed the risk and talked to him about it before it was an issue. Other than that it’s been great!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I’m glad I got it
reviews.reviewText: I really was undecided on whether or not I would buy this since my son is 6 and growing. Some photos the kids look uncomfortable sitting on the bench seat. But it actually works out great. You will need to adjust the stroller seats/car seat to the right configuration and see which way is the most comfortable for all the kids.I even turn the bench the other direction facing in if i need to and he holds on to the stroller bars on the side. It works for me! He even stands on the seat ! Either way. There is a way for this to work for your family. I don’t regret it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2021
reviews.reviewText: The bench is a great extra little seat. Excellent quality, super easy to install. My only complaint is that when used as a 3rd seat option. There isn’t much space for a child to sit comfortably. Perhaps If the frame were just a little longer it would be great!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A great addition
reviews.reviewText: I like that the bench seat is easy to install and you never have to take it out when folding the stroller. Very light also, so it doesnt add much weight to the already heavy joovy qool. I do kick the footrest sometimes so when my kid isnt sitting in the bench seat, i just fold the footrest out of the way. My kid fits in it just fine. Now i cant control what he will do while sitting in it... sometimes when bored, he does reach for the wheels since it's right there. And he will want to twist so he can see the front instead. He's finally stopped lifting up the footrest to his chest (like it's a belly bar)... wish it locked into place while down. Still a great addition to the joovy qool.

This is the perfect addition to the Joovy Qool stroller if you have multiple children. My two year old daughter loves to sit on this bench as she can easily get on and off. It is much more convenient than adding a second Rumbleseat in my opinion.

reviews.reviewerName: Very expensive !!! Just because we don’t have choice

reviews.reviewText: Sturdy. And good quality/material used in it...perfect in every way.

reviews.reviewTitle: The best part of this stroller!
reviews.reviewText: I researched so many strollers and this attachment is worth every penny. I started using it when my daughter was 3 and she still has many years left to use it. It makes is so easier to let her get on and off and folds down when needed (but I don’t find I need to use that feature mu h, as we use it almost everytime with the stroller
I like that my toddler has something to sit on when she's tired I dislike that I can't have anything hanging from the bar because it's in her face. 🙃
